key_points: At least five people were killed in a massive crash involving 75 to 100 vehicles on an icy Texas interstate.
The accident occurred on Interstate 35 near downtown Fort Worth, amid a winter storm affecting a large section of the U.S.
The exact number of injured from the crash remained unknown as police continued their efforts at the scene.
A reunification center for family members has been set up at a community center following the event.
The Fort Worth Police advised individuals involved in minor accidents to exchange information and move on.
Several other crashes were reported in the area due to the icy conditions.
At least eight people have died in the metroplex area, including incidents in Dallas and Arlington.
In Austin, a pileup involving more than two dozen vehicles occurred on an icy road, injuring one person.
More than 125,000 homes and businesses were without electricity, mostly in Kentucky and West Virginia.
Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear declared a state of emergency, urging people to stay home due to icy conditions.
